name: Azure Virtual Machine Boot Diagnostics Disabled
description:
This policy identifies Azure Virtual Machines which have Boot Diagnostic setting Disabled. Boot Diagnostics when enabled for the virtual machine, captures a Screenshot and Console Output during virtual machine startup. This would help in troubleshooting the virtual machine when it enters a non-bootable state.

For details refer:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/troubleshooting/boot-diagnostics

NOTE: We are excluding Databricks virtual machines (Azure-managed solutions) in reporting as Boot Diagnostic setting can not be enabled on those.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'azure' AND api.name = 'azure-vm-list' AND json.rule = powerState contains running and ['properties.diagnosticsProfile'].['bootDiagnostics'].['enabled'] is false and tags.Vendor does not equal Databricks
recommendation:
1. Log in to the Azure Portal
2. Select 'Virtual Machines' from the left pane
3. Select the reported virtual machine
4. Select 'Boot Diagnostics'
5. Click on 'Settings'
6. Boot diagnostics can be used with a custom storage account or with a pre-provisioned storage account managed by Microsoft. Set stoarge account either managed or custom based on your requirement.
7. Click on 'Save'
